thread.title: How a LA outlet mall will welcome Special Olympics 2015 World Games athletes
thread.title_full: How a LA outlet mall will welcome Special Olympics 2015 World Games athletes

author: Don Simkovich, LA Business News Examiner
title: How a LA outlet mall will welcome Special Olympics 2015 World Games athletes
text:
How a LA outlet mall will welcome Special Olympics 2015 World Games athletes Use your key for the next article Comment Play The SOMO Joy cheer team has been competing at the Special Olympics Maryland State games since 2011. This year they're headed to the Special Olympics World Games in Los Angeles, California. on.aol.com 
Beach volleyball, a half marathon, and equestrian competitions are among the 25 sports of the 2015 Special Olympics World Games taking place in the greater Los Angeles area from July 25 to August 1. The city will welcome 7,000 athletes from 177 different countries. 
International tourism plays a major role in Southern California's economy and area businesses are prepared to accommodate the influx of crowds. At the Citadel Outlet mall along the 5 Freeway in the City of Commerce, about 60 percent of the shoppers at the Citadel have zip codes from outside the United States. 
The Citadel Outlets is hosting a Reach Up and Shop program where Special Olympics participants, coaches and select guests can receive 20 percent off at participating outlets that include Kate Spade, Michael Kors, and H&M. A free shuttle service will run from Union Station and other points in downtown Los Angeles. The program is time limited and will run from July 25 to August 2. 
The program is unique to the Citadel, the shopping center that was originally designed for the Samson Tire and Rubber Company in 1929 and later housed the Uniroyal Tire plant until that company closed it in 1978. Some original features have been preserved in the landmark wall that was designed as an Assyrian palace. 
For further reading on Reach Up and Shop, visit the event website . Suggested Links
